::: {.column width="50%"}




::: {style="font-size: 85%"}

- 1845: Breaks with Feuerbach and "young Hegelianism."

- 1845&mdash;1849: Brussels period.

- 1846: Writes *The German Ideology* with Engels.

- 1849: Moves to London.

- 1851&mdash;1862: Collaboration with the *new York Daily Tribune*.

- 1859: Writes *A Contribution to the Critique of Political Economy*.

- 1863: Writes *Theories of Surplus Value*.

- 1867: *Capital*, Volume I is published.

- 1883: Death of Marx.

- 1895: Death of Engels.

# The labor process {background-color="#62259D"}


## The labor process

<br>

[Initial]{.note} considerations in *Wage-Labour and Capital* (1847).

. . .

<br>

Further [developed]{.note} in *A Contribution to the Critique of Political Economy* (1859).

. . .

<br>

More [mature]{.note} views in the *Grundrisse* (1857&mdash;1758).

. . .

<br>

[Final form]{.note} in *Capital, volume I* (1867).


## The labor process

<br>

Some [key features]{.note}:

- [Two classes]{.note}: workers and capitalists;

- Where does [value]{.note} come from?;

- The "[reproduction]{.note} cycle": *M*&mdash;*C*&mdash;*M'*, where *M'>M*;

- The origin of [surplus-value]{.note}: The production process;

- [Labor-power]{.note} *vs.* specific abilities;

- Productive power of labor: *v*;

- Constant capital: *c*;

- [Overall value]{.note} of a commodity (*m*): *m = c + v + s*;

- [Absolute]{.note} *vs*. [relative]{.note} surplus-value.
